Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; FAYENCE; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of Bakendjehouty
Description: This funerary statuette was discovered at Abydos during the excavations of J. Garstang in 1908-1909. It belongs to the category of "overseer", dressed in a large kilt and holding a whip in hand. The body of the person is covered by Chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead.
